value: Look at the course outline to see what’s coming up
Think about the purpose for listening
Think about what you expect to hear
Do all reading, tasks or homework set by tutor
Does your prediction match what the tutor’s saying?
This helps prepare your mind to understand more
Is it what you expected, or different?
Don’t give up: remember, it isn’t easy.

data.stimulus:
Get ready to listen 

Listen to a lecturer talking about about the purpose of lectures.

 

  • Answer the questions while you listen.
  • Before you start listening read the questions below.
  • Then listen again to check your answers.

 

 

 

1. The lecturers expects you to understand everything about the lecture.

data.template: 2. During the lecture you are expected to get the {{response}} of the topic.
3. According to Steven Draper, it's easier to {{response}}.
4. According to Steven Draper, the academic community mostly shares ideas by {{response}}.

options.label: a. Reading about it, listening to a lecture about it and then discussing it.
b. Reading about it, discussing it and then listening to a lecture about it.
c. Discussing it, reading about it and then listening to a lecture about it.

data.stimulus: 5. According to the lecturer, you process information about a topic by...

options.label: a. note down everything you hear
b. compare what the lecturer says with the text
c. listen for key points and think about them

data.stimulus: 6. During the lecture you should...

options.label: a. Ask the university for permission
b. Ask the lecturer for permission

data.stimulus: 7. What should you do if you want to record a lecture?
